<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/us-hits-100-million-vaccine-doses-administered?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker: XL Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/us-hits-100-million-vaccine-doses-administered" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzcxL3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bumping up our weekly vaccine tracker to “top story” status today because, well, there’s a ton of vaccine news going on and there is nothing more important to the global economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s start with the numbers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">US: </strong></span><span>The country hit a milestone of </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/12/us-tops-100-million-covid-vaccine-doses-administered-13percent-of-adults-now-fully-vaccinated.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100 million vaccine doses administered</a></span><span> yesterday, and 13.5% of all US adults are fully vaccinated (meaning two doses of Moderna or Pfizer-BioNTech, or one of J&J). The seven-day average of doses administered per day is </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/covid-vaccine-states-distribution-doses/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2.23 million</a></span><span>, a 9% bump over the week before.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">International: </strong></span><span>More than 345 million doses have been administered across 121 countries, a 27% jump from last week.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now to the headlines...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The debate over unused doses</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A cross-border kerfuffle is brewing over <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/11/us/politics/coronavirus-astrazeneca-united-states.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">millions of unused doses</a> of AstraZeneca’s vaccine. Those doses, which are currently sitting in cold storage in the US, aren’t being used because the US has yet to authorize the vaccine. More than 70 countries <em>have </em>authorized this vaccine, so they’ve been asking the US to please kindly hand over the doses that are sitting around.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, AstraZeneca itself entered the chat, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-12/astrazeneca-asks-biden-to-consider-shipping-u-s-doses-to-eu?utm_source=google&utm_medium=bd&cmpId=google&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asking the Biden administration</a></span><span> to consider sending the doses to the EU.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The White House, which is facing increased pressure to send these doses abroad, said that’s not on the table.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here: </strong>The US ordered 300 million doses of AstraZeneca’s vaccine last year, but regulators are still waiting on data from a clinical trial to begin the authorization process. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Meanwhile, more age limits are coming down</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An increasing number of states are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/11/world/covid-19-coronavirus#covid-vaccine-eligibility?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanding eligibility</a> to people in the “no, I don’t quite remember Woodstock” range. Texas is opening up doses to anyone 50 or older starting next week, and Georgia, Minnesota, and Ohio will also begin loosening age requirements.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Michigan said all adults will be eligible on April 5, almost a month ahead of President Biden’s mandate. Yesterday, he pledged that all US adults would be able to sign up to get a vaccine by May 1.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIG TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/marco-rubio-supported-amazons-unionization-drive?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Umm That’s Kinda <em>Our</em> Thing: Rubio Writes About Amazon
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Florida Sen. Marco Rubio " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Mzc0L21hcmNvX3J1YmlvLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drew Angerer/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Marco Rubio, a Florida Republican, found common cause with the Federal Trade Commission and fans of <em>Sneaky Pete</em> by getting peeved at Amazon. In a <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2021/03/12/amazon-union-not-helping-working-class-economy-column/6947823002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">USA Today op-ed</a> published yesterday, Rubio railed against the company and backed the workers currently pushing to unionize at a warehouse in Bessemer, Alabama. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The move made him one of </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/sen-marco-rubio-supports-amazon-workers-push-to-unionize-in-alabama-11615559462?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">very few</a></span><span> Republicans to support organized labor. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Rubio’s Amazon irritation began earlier this month, when the company removed from Kindle and Audible a book titled <em>When Harry Became Sally</em> on the basis that it framed transgender identity as a mental illness. A group of senators, including Rubio, wrote to Amazon to protest the decision. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So...no, Rubio didn’t decide to buck his party's position on labor organizing after downing some IPAs with Bernie Sanders. Rubio maintained in the op-ed that “adversarial relations between labor and management are wrong.” He clarified that he supported the Bessemer workers because Amazon’s leadership “has decided to wage culture war against working-class values.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Amazon workers’ votes on whether to unionize are due by the 29th. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/chewy-cofounder-lead-gamestops-ecommerce-business?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
GameStop to ABC
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Notebook" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=268 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/RcC4fP1Tjgghi/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Notebook" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/RcC4fP1Tjgghi/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It still isn’t over. ABC’s documentary on the GameStop saga <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/media/542536-abcs-gamestop-documentary-to-be-released-next-week?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debuts on Hulu</a> next week, but it might want to start planning a sequel as the stock continues to rise and fall faster than an old air mattress. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The video game store-turned-Reddit-darling <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-12/gamestop-coasts-toward-100-weekly-gain-defying-gravity-again?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained 92%</a> this week to close at $265 per share. That’s down from a peak of $483 in late January, but way up from $17 at the beginning of the year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week’s moonward trajectory followed an announcement that Chewy cofounder and GameStop board member Ryan Cohen will lead the retailer’s transition to e-commerce.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In November, Cohen <a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1326380/000101359420000821/rc13da3-111620.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent a letter</a> to GameStop’s board that gives us some insight into where he’ll focus his efforts. He wrote that GameStop needs to prune underperforming stores and markets and catch up to three major changes in the gaming industry:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The switch from physical games and consoles to streamed content (like </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/10/cloud-gaming-big-tech-streaming-wars?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cloud gaming</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The growth of </span><span><em>Candy Crush</em></span><span>-ing mobile gamers</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The rising number of gamers buying equipment from mass retailers like Amazon</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Cohen turned Chewy into the “Amazon for pets,” proving there’s an appetite for Not Everything Stores. His next task will be to turn GameStop’s reputation from “ye olde gaming equipment pawn shop” into “Amazon for gaming.”</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How can you tell when it’s springtime? Hint: it’s got nothin’ to do with flowers, sunshine, or birdies chirping in trees. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s got everything to do with everyone rockin’ <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-mar21?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x13mar21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA’s vibrantly-colored kicks</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Come out of hibernation looking like a tulip in full bloom while sporting a pair of these crazy-comfortable, sustainably made CARIUMA sneaks. <strong style="color:#000">They come in an array of feel-good spring colors—like rose, green, yellow, and classic white. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can dress em’ up or down. The one constant? Your CARIUMAs are carbon neutral. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s never been a better time to wake up and smell fresh sneaks, because last spring, <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-mar21?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x13mar21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">these babies had an 8k-person waitlist</a>. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/key-performance-indicators-stats-takeover?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/key-performance-indicators-stats-takeover" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Facebook virtual reality " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDM5L2ZhY2Vib29rX3ZpcnR1YWxfcmVhbGl0eS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Typically, the KPI section consists of one stat, one quote, and one read. But honestly we found way too many interesting stats yesterday, so today we’re doing a <em>statistics takeover.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech stat:</strong> Facebook has nearly 10,000 employees working on its augmented and virtual reality devices, according to <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/the-people-with-power-at-facebook-as-its-hardware-commerce-ambitions-expand?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Information</a>. That’s almost 20% of its entire workforce, and double the number of Twitter’s total employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wealth stat: </strong>US households finished 2020 with a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-household-net-worth-rose-5-6-in-4q-to-record-130-2-trillion-11615482059?mod=hp_major_pos1#cxrecs_s&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record net worth</a> of $130.2 trillion, up 10% from the year before. Asset prices across the board, from stocks to houses, climbed last year despite the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Streaming stat: </strong>HBO Max is <a href="https://deadline.com/2021/03/hbo-max-will-hit-million-subscribers-2025-att-warnermedia-streaming-1234713072/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">updating</a> its subscriber targets to 120 million–150 million by 2025; the previous forecast had been 75 million to 90 million. Parent AT&T expects revenue in the HBO division to more than double to $15 billion by the same year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Babies stat: </strong>More twins are being born now than at <a href="https://www.newscientist.com/article/2270822-the-number-of-twins-in-the-world-is-the-highest-it-has-ever-been/#ixzz6otJCC2ji?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">any point in history</a>, according to a study published yesterday. The rate of twin births has grown by a third since the 1980s, which the researchers attribute to a rise in fertility treatments.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/12/toronto-restaurant-renames-menu-items-fool-expense-reports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ever order lunch with coworkers and wonder, “Can I expense this?” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Good Fortune Burger, a local joint in Toronto, is eliminating all your concerns. In a perfectly executed marketing campaign, it temporarily <a href="https://www.blogto.com/eat_drink/2021/02/toronto-restaurant-naming-menu-after-office-supplies-expense-meals/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">renamed</a> some menu items as generic office supplies so you can expense them without raising any HR eyebrows. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s what the menu looks like from <a href="https://www.ubereats.com/ca/toronto/food-delivery/good-fortune-burger-college/SlS7Rn6dQ1SVb59NxiWt5A?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Uber Eats</a>:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzczL21lbnUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"> Just don’t be the person who orders their ergonomic aluminum laptop stand well-done.</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBumping up our weekly vaccine tracker to “top story” status today because, well, there’s a ton of vaccine news going on and there is nothing more important to the global economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s start with the numbers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUS: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe country hit a milestone of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/12/us-tops-100-million-covid-vaccine-doses-administered-13percent-of-adults-now-fully-vaccinated.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100 million vaccine doses administered\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday, and 13.5% of all US adults are fully vaccinated (meaning two doses of Moderna or Pfizer-BioNTech, or one of J\u0026J). The seven-day average of doses administered per day is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/covid-vaccine-states-distribution-doses/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2.23 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a 9% bump over the week before.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInternational: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 345 million doses have been administered across 121 countries, a 27% jump from last week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow to the headlines...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe debate over unused doses\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA cross-border kerfuffle is brewing over \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/11/us/politics/coronavirus-astrazeneca-united-states.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emillions of unused doses\u003c/a\u003e of AstraZeneca’s vaccine. Those doses, which are currently sitting in cold storage in the US, aren’t being used because the US has yet to authorize the vaccine. More than 70 countries \u003cem\u003ehave \u003c/em\u003eauthorized this vaccine, so they’ve been asking the US to please kindly hand over the doses that are sitting around.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, AstraZeneca itself entered the chat, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-12/astrazeneca-asks-biden-to-consider-shipping-u-s-doses-to-eu?utm_source=google\u0026utm_medium=bd\u0026cmpId=google\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easking the Biden administration\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to consider sending the doses to the EU.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe White House, which is facing increased pressure to send these doses abroad, said that’s not on the table.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here: \u003c/strong\u003eThe US ordered 300 million doses of AstraZeneca’s vaccine last year, but regulators are still waiting on data from a clinical trial to begin the authorization process. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMeanwhile, more age limits are coming down\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn increasing number of states are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/03/11/world/covid-19-coronavirus#covid-vaccine-eligibility?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanding eligibility\u003c/a\u003e to people in the “no, I don’t quite remember Woodstock” range. Texas is opening up doses to anyone 50 or older starting next week, and Georgia, Minnesota, and Ohio will also begin loosening age requirements.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMichigan said all adults will be eligible on April 5, almost a month ahead of President Biden’s mandate. Marco Rubio, a Florida Republican, found common cause with the Federal Trade Commission and fans of \u003cem\u003eSneaky Pete\u003c/em\u003e by getting peeved at Amazon. In a \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2021/03/12/amazon-union-not-helping-working-class-economy-column/6947823002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eUSA Today op-ed\u003c/a\u003e published yesterday, Rubio railed against the company and backed the workers currently pushing to unionize at a warehouse in Bessemer, Alabama. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe move made him one of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/sen-marco-rubio-supports-amazon-workers-push-to-unionize-in-alabama-11615559462?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003every few\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Republicans to support organized labor. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eRubio’s Amazon irritation began earlier this month, when the company removed from Kindle and Audible a book titled \u003cem\u003eWhen Harry Became Sally\u003c/em\u003e on the basis that it framed transgender identity as a mental illness. A group of senators, including Rubio, wrote to Amazon to protest the decision. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo...no, Rubio didn’t decide to buck his party's position on labor organizing after downing some IPAs with Bernie Sanders. Rubio maintained in the op-ed that “adversarial relations between labor and management are wrong.” He clarified that he supported the Bessemer workers because Amazon’s leadership “has decided to wage culture war against working-class values.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt still isn’t over. ABC’s documentary on the GameStop saga \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/media/542536-abcs-gamestop-documentary-to-be-released-next-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edebuts on Hulu\u003c/a\u003e next week, but it might want to start planning a sequel as the stock continues to rise and fall faster than an old air mattress. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe video game store-turned-Reddit-darling \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-12/gamestop-coasts-toward-100-weekly-gain-defying-gravity-again?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egained 92%\u003c/a\u003e this week to close at $265 per share. That’s down from a peak of $483 in late January, but way up from $17 at the beginning of the year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week’s moonward trajectory followed an announcement that Chewy cofounder and GameStop board member Ryan Cohen will lead the retailer’s transition to e-commerce.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn November, Cohen \u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1326380/000101359420000821/rc13da3-111620.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esent a letter\u003c/a\u003e to GameStop’s board that gives us some insight into where he’ll focus his efforts. He wrote that GameStop needs to prune underperforming stores and markets and catch up to three major changes in the gaming industry:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe switch from physical games and consoles to streamed content (like \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/10/cloud-gaming-big-tech-streaming-wars?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecloud gaming\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe growth of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eCandy Crush\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e-ing mobile gamers\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe rising number of gamers buying equipment from mass retailers like Amazon\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCohen turned Chewy into the “Amazon for pets,” proving there’s an appetite for Not Everything Stores. His next task will be to turn GameStop’s reputation from “ye olde gaming equipment pawn shop” into “Amazon for gaming.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" But honestly we found way too many interesting stats yesterday, so today we’re doing a \u003cem\u003estatistics takeover.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTech stat:\u003c/strong\u003e Facebook has nearly 10,000 employees working on its augmented and virtual reality devices, according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/the-people-with-power-at-facebook-as-its-hardware-commerce-ambitions-expand?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Information\u003c/a\u003e. That’s almost 20% of its entire workforce, and double the number of Twitter’s total employees.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWealth stat: \u003c/strong\u003eUS households finished 2020 with a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-household-net-worth-rose-5-6-in-4q-to-record-130-2-trillion-11615482059?mod=hp_major_pos1#cxrecs_s\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord net worth\u003c/a\u003e of $130.2 trillion, up 10% from the year before. Asset prices across the board, from stocks to houses, climbed last year despite the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStreaming stat: \u003c/strong\u003eHBO Max is \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2021/03/hbo-max-will-hit-million-subscribers-2025-att-warnermedia-streaming-1234713072/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupdating\u003c/a\u003e its subscriber targets to 120 million–150 million by 2025; the previous forecast had been 75 million to 90 million. Parent AT\u0026T expects revenue in the HBO division to more than double to $15 billion by the same year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBabies stat: \u003c/strong\u003eMore twins are being born now than at \u003ca href=\"https://www.newscientist.com/article/2270822-the-number-of-twins-in-the-world-is-the-highest-it-has-ever-been/#ixzz6otJCC2ji?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eany point in history\u003c/a\u003e, according to a study published yesterday.
